DataElement.preferredName: Modified Toxicity Criteria Fever Without Infection Disorder Condition Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the modified toxicity criteria for fever without infection grade.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: National Marrow Donor Program Modified Toxicity Criteria Fever Without Infectious Disorder Condition
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Criteria established by the National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP) that assesses potential toxicities following peripheral blood or bone marrow stem cell collection from donors and includes: fever in absence of infections; fatigue; rashes; injection site reaction; nausea; vomiting; loss of appetite; inability to sleep; dizziness, vertigo, or lightheadedness; fainting; and pain.:Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._A state of being, such as a state of health.
